required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: LAAC-registry: Clinical Outcome After Echocardiography-guided LAA-closure
clinical_study.official_title: LAAC-registry: Clinical Outcome After Echocardiography-guided LAA-closure

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims at comparing, in a large cohort of consecutive clinically indicated left atrial appendage closure, clinical and imaging outcomes between different subpopulations.

detailed_description.textblock: Percutaneous left atrial appendage closure (LAAC) has established itself in clinical practice as a safe and efficient therapeutic option for atrial fibrillation patients with a relative/absolute contraindication to oral anticoagulation. The purpose of this observational study is to prospectively collect procedural and follow-up data of all patients submitted to a clinically indicate LAAC in order to assess the impact of patient characteristics, procedural technique (imaging used to guide/plan procedure, device implanted, post-procedural drug regimens, etc.) on procedural safety and efficacy. The endpoints will be assessed by means of clinical follow-up at 1-3-5 years after LAAC and imaging exams (TEE at1-3 months, CCTA at 1-13months).

primary_outcome.description: Composite of Death, cerebrovascular events, cardiac tamponade, need for urgent surgery, need for cardiopulmonary resuscitation, device embolization, non vascular access-related major or life-threatening bleeding (according to the Bleeding academic research Criteria (BARC) type 3a, 3b, 3c, or 5) or acute kidney injury.

primary_outcome.measure: Primary Efficacy Endpoint - Incidence of cardiovascular death, ischemic stroke and systemic embolism
primary_outcome.description: Protection from cardiovascular death, ischemic stroke and systemic embolism

primary_outcome.measure: Secondary Efficacy Endpoint - Incidence of technical success
primary_outcome.description: Technical success defined as adequate LAA ostium closure (without residual PDL>5mm or patent lobes) in absence of device complications (according to the Munich Consensus Document)

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility Endpoint - dose of contrast medium (ml)
Feasibility Endpoint - number of device implantation attempt during the procedure (number)
primary_outcome.description: number of device implantation attempt during the procedure (number)

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility Endpoint - number of device change during the procedure (number)
primary_outcome.description: number of device change during the procedure (number)

Composite of death, stroke, systemic embolism, pulmonary embolism, myocardial infarction, and major or life-threatening bleeding (according to the Bleeding academic research Criteria (BARC) type 3a, 3b, 3c, or 5) not procedure-related.
LAA patency and its subtypes as evaluated by TEE and/or CCTA
Device related thrombus detected by TEE and /or CCTA on the atrial surface of device

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of atrial surface of device covered
Maximal Hypoattentuated Thickening on atrial surface of device

intervention.intervention_name: Use of echocardiography guidance for LAAC
intervention.description: Since August 2015, the echocardiography is routinely used by majority of operators to guide LAAC

study_pop.textblock: Patients with paroxysmal, persistent, or permanent non-valvular AF and CHA2DS2-VASc Score of ≥2 that are scheduled to undergo to an elective Left Atrial Appendage Closure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age> 18
- Written informed consent to participate in the study
- Patients with paroxysmal, persistent, or permanent non-valvular AF and CHA2DS2-VASc Score of ≥2 that are planned for an elective LAA-closure
- Anatomic characteristics allow placement of a CE marked device, dedicated for LAAC
Exclusion Criteria:
- None. Considering the nature of the project, which is to prospectively collect information on all patients treated with LAAC in our center, we will only exclude patients unwilling to sign the informed consent.

overall_official.affiliation: Insel Gruppe AG, Inselspital, Universitätsklinik für Kardiologie
